page.title: 16Wrest Park- Silsoe
page.content:
Wrest Park-National Institute of Agricultural Engineering
Wrest Park is situated close to Silsoe where the countryside is typically flat with views of the Chilterns. The estate is leased to the N.I.A.E. who take pride in their role of preserving the house and gardens as a National Monument.In the early 1900's Wrest Park was the residence of the American Ambassador, while during the l914-18 war it was used as a military hospital In 1947 the Ministry of Public Buildings and Works aquired the estate Wrest Park is famous for its Gardens. The Great Garden of which the Pavilion is the most dominant feature was laid out by Thomas Archer, in the formal manner and altered by 'Capability Brown between l758 and l760. There is also an Orangery.
